results.definition: a white fatty substance that forms a medullary sheath around the axis cylinder of some nerve fibers
lower or hindmost part of the brain; continuous with spinal cord; (`bulb' is an old term for medulla oblongata)
examples: the medulla oblongata is the most vital part of the brain because it contains centers controlling breathing and heart functioning

results.definition: the inner part of an organ or structure in plant or animal
